Pre-Game Insights: The Houston Astros face the Detroit Tigers in Game 2 of the AL Wild Card series, aiming to even the series after dropping Game 1.
Hunter Brown has dominated Detroit throughout the regular season.
Tyler Holton has been solid in relief this season but faces a daunting task against a powerful Astros lineup.
The Astros are favored at -175 after their Game 1 loss, with the Tigers as +145 underdogs.
The total is set at 7.5, reflecting the expectation of a low-scoring game.
Riley Greene leads the Tigers with 24 home runs and 74 RBIs.
The Tigers' .234 team batting average and lack of depth in their lineup remain concerns.
Tyler Holton has primarily worked as a reliever, posting a 2.66 ERA over 74 appearances this season.
Holton’s lack of starting experience in a postseason setting raises concerns.
Yordan Alvarez continues to be a force in the middle of the Astros' lineup with 35 home runs, 86 RBIs, and a .308 average.
The Astros’ .262 team batting average and .322 OBP illustrate their balanced attack.
Hunter Brown had an outstanding regular season, finishing with a 14-7 record, a 3.38 ERA, and a 1.17 WHIP over 189 innings.
Brown has been especially dominant against Detroit, holding the Tigers to a .198 batting average in his two starts against them this season.
Tyler Holton’s success has come from inducing weak contact, with his changeup and slider being his primary weapons against right-handed hitters.
Hunter Brown has owned the Tigers in previous meetings, limiting their offense to just two earned runs in 14 innings while striking out 19.
